Method Detail

findPath

public static IPath findPath(Point2i from,
                             Point2i to,
                             UnitState unit,
                             CellState[][] knownWorld,
                             IHeuristic heuristic,
                             int maxSearchDist)
Uses the Astar algorithm to compute a sequence of steps required to get from the from position to the to position, given the known world, using the supplied heuristic and performing a search of maxSearchDist depth.

Parameters:
from - the start position
to - the end position
unit - the unit performing the search
knownWorld - an array the size of game map (mapHeight x mapWidth) where the unknown cells have a null value
heuristic - the heuristic function used as part of the Astar algorithm
maxSearchDist - the maximum distance to search from the starting point
Returns:
the path to be followed to the destination given as a sequence of Point2i positions

getDestroyedTowers

public static java.util.List<Tower> getDestroyedTowers(PlayerState clientPlayerState,
                                                       PlayerState serverPlayerState)
Returns the list of destroyed towers, given as a difference between your view of the player state and the server's view on the availableTowers field from the player state. Each time an action is performed, the server will return its view of the player state in the response.

Use this method at the beginning of your round to find out if any of your towers have been destroyed since you last performed an action.

Parameters:
clientPlayerState - your view of your current player state
serverPlayerState - the server's update of the same player state
Returns:
the list of towers that have been destroyed (they no longer appear in the server's view of the availableTowers field from the player state)

getDestroyedTraps

public static java.util.List<TrapObject> getDestroyedTraps(PlayerState clientPlayerState,
                                                           PlayerState serverPlayerState)
Returns the list of destroyed traps, given as a difference between your view of the player state and the server's view on the availableTraps field from the player state. Each time an action is performed, the server will return its view of the player state in the response.

Use this method at the beginning of your round to find out if any of your traps have been destroyed since you last performed an action.

Parameters:
clientPlayerState - your view of your current player state
serverPlayerState - the server's update of the same player state
Returns:
the list of traps that have been destroyed (they no longer appear in the server's view of the availableTowers field from the player state)
